titleStmt.title: 巴慎思敦煌莫高窟照片目录
A Catalogue of Desmond Parsons's Photographs at Dunhuang
titleStmt.author: 罗华庆
Luo Huaqing

head.p: A catalogue of photographs taken inside and around the Mogao Caves by Desmond Parsons during his visit to Dunhuang in 1935. Given first is the scene or deity depicted in the mural or statue shown, followed by its location within the cave complex and then the period to which it dates.
Translated by Shaochen Wang and Na Zhang (UCL).

note.p: 阿弥陀经变·第321窟北壁·初唐
Amitābha Sūtra; Cave 321, north wall; early Tang.
炽盛光佛·第61窟甬道南壁·元
Tejaprabhā Buddha; Cave 61, south wall of corridor; Yuan.
炽盛光佛·第61窟甬道北壁·元
Tejaprabhā Buddha; Cave 61, south wall of corridor; Yuan
道教神将三身·第150窟甬道南壁·清
Three Daoist divine generals; Cave 150, south wall of corridor; Qing.

Daoist divine general; Cave 150, south wall of corridor; Qing.
张议潮出行图之前导·第156窟南壁西侧·晚唐
Head of Zhang Yichao’s procession; Cave 156, western end of south wall; Late Tang.
阿弥陀经变·第334窟北壁·初唐
Amitābha Sūtra; Cave 334, north wall; Early Tang.

Amitābha Sūtra; Cave 334, north wall; Early Tang.

Amitāyurdhyāna Sūtra (detail); Cave 172, eastern end of south wall; High Tang.

Sattva Jātaka (The Hungry Tigress); Cave 428, southern end of east wall; Northern Zhou.

凉国夫人浔阳翟氏供养像及侍从（照片反）·第427窟甬道北壁·宋
Donor portrait of the Lady Zhai of Xunyang and her attendant (image reversed); Cave 427, north wall of corridor; Song.

Attendant bodhisattva; Cave 62, northern corner of niche on west wall; Sui.
第62窟西壁、北壁（局部）·隋

阿弥陀说法图中之观音菩萨像·第57窟南壁·初唐
The bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara, from a depiction of the Buddha Amitābha preaching; Cave 57, south wall; Early Tang.

Ruined image of bodhisattva; Cave 85, north wall of antechamber; Yuan.

Image of Buddha on niche lintel; Cave 285, eastern end of north wall between the first and the second meditation cell; Western Wei.
佛教史迹画和菩萨像三身·第323窟南壁西侧·初唐
Depiction of the history of Buddhism and three bodhisattvas; Cave 323, western end of south wall; Early Tang.

Amitābha Sūtra; Cave 321, north wall; Early Tang.

Amitāyurdhyāna Sūtra; Cave 172, north wall; High Tang.

The thousand buddhas, donors, chariots, horses and mountain forests; Cave 303, northern end of east wall; Sui.

Exterior of caves 85, 85 and 83 (below) and 242, 243, 244 (above).
